question.qText: What is the main idea expressed in this excerpt from "The True Law of Free Monarchies?"

aBtn.aText: A good king will follow the law, even though he is not bound to do so.
A good king is always bound by the laws of parliament.
Parliament has the right to make laws without the king's consent.
A good king should never stoop to follow the laws made for his subjects, since he is above them.
Kings have the right to amend laws, even if they are made by a parliament.
